intro: Matelea lesueurii, commonly known as the Lesueur's mescal bean, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, often blooming in spring. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
